About

Student of bachelor on Information systems at UNICAMP (Campinas, SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil), i am a web-dev lover and always looking to learn the lastest technologies available and see what are the pros and cons of each, so i can understand why and what they are good for, doing this i am "always" going to be prepare to a new situation that i will face up.

I am starting to be active on many PHP and javascript repositories, contributing to open source projects. I am also active on laravel slack chat and on stackoverflow helping others with problems.

My main focus when i am coding is to create user readable code and functional without any performance compromise.

Projects

Meeting system

The development of a system to control monthly meetings and other functionalities related to it. Users could make a checkout of their attendance using the barcode printed on their ID.

It was developed using PHP with MYSQL as a database, with JQuery

ERP Development

Development of a micro ERP to a family business, it will control all the sales made. Nowadays the system is under reformulation to fit other business requisites, for example, stock and orders management, reducing administrative costs (time and money).

It will help to calculate revenue, earns, EBITDA, among other financial indicators.

The First version was developed with procedural PHP, to be able to do real time features, it is being build with NodeJS, using Sequelize.js as ORM.

IV Tecnologia em foco fair. - Institucional website - UNICAMP

Developed with wordpress, its main goal was to show the lectures schedule, so students could check and plan themselves, also it worked as a photos archive. Project developed with André Matulionis dos Santos. You can check the website Here.

Converting Courseviewer to the WEB envieroment.

This project is being built to my TCC (project to end the major) with the goal to convert the current version of Courseviewer (Java Desktop) to a WEB version, so more people could have access to it, because to use the current version, it requires you to install JVM.

CourseViewer is a tool which helps coordinators, students and professors understand majors plannings, the entire major, delivering clear and centralized information. If the user needs to find all the required information, he/she would have to access different pages on the university website, have a few tabs on her/his browser, which is pretty difficult. A missunderstood information can cause a lot of problems on the student's life.

Its being built with a partnership with André Matulionis dos Santos, which is responsible to build the front-end of the application.

Me on the other hand, i am responsible to build all the rest endpoints, structure the database tables, make all the queries and make sure that all the information that the view layer requires is available.

Because this project aims to have contribution in the future, the main goal is to have an app with a clear code, clear file structure and easier to maintain, different from the desktop version. I also created contribution guides and policies, so the code will maintain clean and organized.

It's being build with Laravel (Using passport and some other packages), PostgreSQL and D3 to be able to draw all the nodes and graphs.
